member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.AccordionAnimationCollapse
member.summary: A class that represents the animation to appear while collapsing the .
member.remarks: You can apply the animation effect and transform duration for accordion collapse action by specifying value to corresponding property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.AccordionAnimationCollapse.Duration
member.summary: Gets or sets the time duration to transform content on collapse action.
member.value: If we set the duration value, then the content transforms with in specified duration otherwise the default duration value `400` is set.
member.remarks: The interval value accepts in milliseconds.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.AccordionAnimationCollapse.Easing
member.summary: Gets or sets the easing effect applied when transforming the content.
member.value: If we set the easing value, then the specified easing effect is applied for expand action otherwise the default easing value linear is set.
member.remarks: This property will accepts the `animation-timing-function` css values to apply content transition accordingly.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.AccordionItem
member.summary: A class that represents accordion panels of component.
member.remarks: You can render header and content of accordion by specifying value to corresponding property.
member.example:
In the below code example, a basic accordion panel has been added using tag directive.
<SfAccordion> <AccordionItems> <AccordionItem Header="ASP.NET"> <ContentTemplate> Microsoft ASP.NET is a set of technologies in the Microsoft .NET Framework for building Web applications and XML Web services. </ContentTemplate> </AccordionItem> <AccordionItem Header="ASP.NET MVC"> <ContentTemplate> The Model-View-Controller (MVC) architectural pattern separates an application into three main components: the model, the view, and the controller. </ContentTemplate> </AccordionItem> <AccordionItem Header="JavaScript"> <ContentTemplate> JavaScript (JS) is an interpreted computer programming language. It was originally implemented as part of web browsers so that client-side scripts could interact with the user, control the browser, communicate asynchronously, and alter the document content that was displayed. </ContentTemplate> </AccordionItem> </AccordionItems> </SfAccordion>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.AccordionItem.ChildContent
member.summary: Gets or sets the child content for the accordion item.
member.value: The value used to build the content.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.AccordionItem.HeaderTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets template as , that defines custom appearance of accordion header.
member.value: A template content that specifies the visualization of accordion header. The default value is null.

example.code: C Sharp(C#)

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.AccordionItem.ContentTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets template as , that defines custom appearance of accordion content.
member.value: A template content that specifies the visualization of accordion content. The default value is null.

example.code: C# is intended to be a simple, modern, general-purpose, object-oriented programming language. Its development team is led by Anders Hejlsberg. The most recent version is C# 5.0, which was released on August 15, 2012.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.AccordionItem.Content
member.summary: Gets or sets the text content to be displayed for accordion item.
member.value: Accepts a string value. The default value is null.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.AccordionItem.CssClass
member.summary: Gets or sets the classes for accordion item to customize the accordion header and content.
member.value: If we set the css class, then the custom class is applied for accordion item. The default value is null.

example.code: <SfAccordion> <AccordionItems> <AccordionItem CssClass="item1"> <HeaderTemplate> Margeret Peacock </HeaderTemplate> <ContentTemplate> Microsoft ASP.NET is a set of technologies in the Microsoft .NET Framework for building Web applications and XML Web services. </ContentTemplate> </AccordionItem> </AccordionItems> </SfAccordion>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.AccordionItem.Disabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the accordion panel is disabled or not.
member.value: true, to disable the accordion panel. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.AccordionItem.Expanded
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the accordion panel is expanded or not.
member.value: true, to expand the accordion panel. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.AccordionItem.Header
member.summary: Gets or sets the header text to be displayed for accordion item.
member.value: Accepts a string value. The default value is null.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.AccordionItem.IconCss
member.summary: Gets or sets a CSS class string to include an icon or image for accordion header.
member.value: Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to include an icon or image for the accordion item. The default value is null.
member.remarks: This property value is only applied for accordion header.

example.code: <SfAccordion> <AccordionItems> <AccordionItem IconCss="e-icons e-home" Content="Home icon rendered in header"></AccordionItem> </AccordionItems> </SfAccordion>

member.summary: Gets or sets whether the accordion panel is hidden or not.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfAccordion
member.summary: Accordion is a vertically collapsible panel that displays one or more panels at a time.
member.remarks: Accordion items can be populated by specifying within tag directive.
member.example:
In the below code example, a basic accordion component initialized with tag directive.
<SfAccordion> <AccordionItems> <AccordionItem Header="ASP.NET"> <ContentTemplate> Microsoft ASP.NET is a set of technologies in the Microsoft .NET Framework for building Web applications and XML Web services. </ContentTemplate> </AccordionItem> <AccordionItem Header="ASP.NET MVC"> <ContentTemplate> The Model-View-Controller (MVC) architectural pattern separates an application into three main components: the model, the view, and the controller. </ContentTemplate> </AccordionItem> <AccordionItem Header="JavaScript"> <ContentTemplate> JavaScript (JS) is an interpreted computer programming language. It was originally implemented as part of web browsers so that client-side scripts could interact with the user, control the browser, communicate asynchronously, and alter the document content that was displayed. </ContentTemplate> </AccordionItem> </AccordionItems> </SfAccordion>

member.summary: Method invoked when the component is ready to start.
member.returns: A System.Threading.Tasks.Task representing any asynchronous operation.

member.returns: A System.Threading.Tasks.Task representing any asynchronous operation.

member.summary: Gets or sets the list of accordion items that will be populated using the tag directive.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfAccordion.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to persist component's state between page reloads. When set to true, the property is persisted.
member.value: true, if the component's state persistence is enabled. The default value is false.
member.remarks: Component's property will be stored in browser local storage to persist component's state when page reloads. It is mandatory to provide to persist ExpandedIndices property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfAccordion.LoadOnDemand
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to render all the accordion content on initial load or not.
member.value: If we set false, then all the contents are rendered on initial load, The default value is true.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfAccordion.EnableRtl
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the right to left direction is enabled for accordion component.
member.value: true, the right to left direction is enabled for accordion component. The default value is `false`.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfAccordion.ExpandMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates options to expand a single or multiple panels at a time.
member.value: One of the enumeration. The default value is
member.remarks: If the ExpandMode is Single, only one will expand at a time. If the ExpandMode is Multiple, more than one will expand at a time.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfAccordion.ExpandedIndices
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of items that is expanded on the initial load.
member.value: If we set the index value, then specified index items were expanded otherwise the default null value is set.

example.code: <SfAccordion @bind-ExpandedIndices="@ExpandedIndices"> <AccordionItems> <AccordionItem Header="ASP.NET"> <ContentTemplate> Microsoft ASP.NET is a set of technologies in the Microsoft .NET Framework for building Web applications and XML Web services. </ContentTemplate> </AccordionItem> <AccordionItem Header="ASP.NET MVC"> <ContentTemplate> The Model-View-Controller (MVC) architectural pattern separates an application into three main components: the model, the view, and the controller. </ContentTemplate> </AccordionItem> <AccordionItem Header="JavaScript"> <ContentTemplate> JavaScript (JS) is an interpreted computer programming language. It was originally implemented as part of web browsers so that client-side scripts could interact with the user, control the browser, communicate asynchronously, and alter the document content that was displayed. </ContentTemplate> </AccordionItem> </AccordionItems> </SfAccordion> @code{ int[] ExpandedIndices = new int[] { 0, 1 }; }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfAccordion.ExpandedIndicesChanged
member.summary: Invokes when index of expanded items were changed.
member.value: Fired when expanded item index changes.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfAccordion.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the accordion element in pixels/number/percentage.
member.value: If we set the height value, then the accordion will render based on specified height otherwise the default height value `auto` is set.
member.remarks: If we set number values, then it is considered as pixels.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfAccordion.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the accordion element in pixels/number/percentage.
member.value: If we set the width value, then the accordion will render based on specified width otherwise the default width value `100%` is set.
member.remarks: If we set number values, then it is considered as pixels.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.AppBarSeparator
member.summary: Represents a component which displays a line to visually group or separate the AppBar contents.
member.remarks: AppBarSeparator shows a vertical line which used to group AppBar contents by separating single or group of AppBar contents.
member.value: It allows to group the Appbar contents.

example.code: <SfAppBar> <SfButton CssClass="e-inherit" IconCss="e-icons e-home"></SfButton> <AppBarSeparator /> <SfButton CssClass="e-inherit" IconCss="e-icons e-pan"></SfButton> </SfAppBar>

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.AppBarSpacer
member.summary: Represents a component that introduce spacing between the AppBar contents which gives an additional space on content layout.
member.remarks: AppBarSpacer provides the space between the components. So, user can tune the spacing between the content like right or left.
member.value: It provides space between the Appbar contents.

example.code: <SfAppBar> <SfButton CssClass="e-inherit" IconCss="e-icons e-home"></SfButton> <AppBarSpacer /> <SfButton CssClass="e-inherit" IconCss="e-icons e-pan"></SfButton> </SfAppBar>

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfAppBar
member.summary: The AppBar displays the information and actions related to the current application screen. It is used to show branding, screen titles, navigation, and actions.
member.remarks: AppBar component can be populated by specifying the child components within tag directive. Support to inherit colors from AppBar provided to SfButton, SfDropDownButton, SfMenu and SfTextBox. Set CssClass property with e-inherit CSS class to inherit the background and color from AppBar.
member.example:
The below example shows AppBar with Primary Button.
<SfAppBar> <SfButton IsPrimary="true">Primary</SfButton> </SfAppBar>
The below example shows AppBar with Buttons which inherits colors from AppBar.
<SfAppBar> <SfButton CssClass="e-inherit" IconCss="e-icons e-home"></SfButton> <AppBarSeparator /> <SfButton CssClass="e-inherit" IconCss="e-icons e-pan"></SfButton> </SfAppBar>
The below example, AppBarSpacer component used to align the Buttons on left and right.
<SfAppBar> <SfButton CssClass="e-inherit" IconCss="e-icons e-home"></SfButton> <AppBarSpacer /> <SfButton CssClass="e-inherit" IconCss="e-icons e-pan"></SfButton> <SfButton CssClass="e-inherit" IconCss="e-icons e-close"></SfButton> </SfAppBar>

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.BreadcrumbItem

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.BreadcrumbOverflowMode
member.summary: Specifies how to display Breadcrumb items in component when the Breadcrumb items exceeds Breadcrumb container or property.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.BreadcrumbOverflowMode.Menu
member.summary: Shows the number of Breadcrumb items that can be accommodated within the container space, and creates a sub menu with the remaining items.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.BreadcrumbOverflowMode.Hidden
member.summary: The specified count will be visible and the remaining items will be hidden. While clicking on the previous item, the hidden item will become visible.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.BreadcrumbOverflowMode.Collapsed
member.summary: Only the first and last items will be visible, and the remaining items will be hidden with collapsed icon. When the collapsed icon is clicked, all items become visible and scroll will be enabled if the space is not enough to show all items.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.BreadcrumbOverflowMode.Wrap
member.summary: Wraps the items on multiple lines when the Breadcrumbs width exceeds the container space.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.BreadcrumbOverflowMode.Scroll
member.summary: Shows an HTML scroll bar when the Breadcrumbs width exceeds the container space.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.BreadcrumbOverflowMode.None
member.summary: Shows all the items on a single line.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfBreadcrumb
member.summary: Breadcrumb component is a graphical user interface that helps to identify or highlight the current location within a hierarchical structure of websites. The aim is to make the user aware of their current position in a hierarchy of website links.
member.remarks: Breadcrumb items can be populated either by specifying property or by specifying within tag directive. and can be used to customize the Breadcrumb component UI using tag directive.
member.example:
In the below code example, a basic Breadcrumb component initialized with tag directive.
<SfBreadcrumb> <BreadcrumbItems> <BreadcrumbItem Text="Home" Url="https://blazor.syncfusion.com/demos/"></BreadcrumbItem> <BreadcrumbItem Text="Components" Url="https://blazor.syncfusion.com/demos/datagrid/overview"></BreadcrumbItem> <BreadcrumbItem Text="Navigations" Url="https://blazor.syncfusion.com/demos/menu-bar/default-functionalities"></BreadcrumbItem> <BreadcrumbItem Text="Breadcrumb" Url="https://blazor.syncfusion.com/demos/breadcrumb/default-functionalities"></BreadcrumbItem> </BreadcrumbItems> </SfBreadcrumb>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfBreadcrumb.Url
member.summary: Gets or sets the Url based on which the Breadcrumb items are generated.
member.value: The value as a Url string to generate Breadcrumb items. The default value is String.Empty.
member.remarks: You can specify only absolute Url to this property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfBreadcrumb.Items
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of breadcrumb items that will be populated using the tag directive.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfBreadcrumb.ActiveItem
member.summary: Gets or sets the of the active breadcrumb item.
member.value: This property contains Url string of active breadcrumb item.
member.remarks: This property is updated only when the has value.

example.code:
<SfBreadcrumb>
                <BreadcrumbItems ActiveItem="@activeItem">
                    <BreadcrumbItem Text="Home" Url="https://blazor.syncfusion.com/demos/"></BreadcrumbItem>
                    <BreadcrumbItem Text="Components" Url="https://blazor.syncfusion.com/demos/datagrid/overview"></BreadcrumbItem>
                    <BreadcrumbItem Text="Navigations" Url="https://blazor.syncfusion.com/demos/menu-bar/default-functionalities"></BreadcrumbItem>
                    <BreadcrumbItem Text="Breadcrumb" Url="https://blazor.syncfusion.com/demos/breadcrumb/default-functionalities"></BreadcrumbItem>
                </BreadcrumbItems>
            </SfBreadcrumb>
            @code {
                private string activeItem = "https://blazor.syncfusion.com/demos/menu-bar/default-functionalities";
            }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfBreadcrumb.MaxItems
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of breadcrumb items to be visible in the breadcrumb component. If the number of items exceeds this count, then items are rendered based on property.
member.value: The number of breadcrumb items to be visible in breadcrumb component. The default value is 0.
member.remarks: The is applicable only if the number of is greater than 2.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfBreadcrumb.OverflowMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates how to display breadcrumb items when the breadcrumb items count exceeds .
member.value: One of the enumeration. The default value is
member.remarks: If the OverflowMode is Hidden, the exceeded items will be hidden and while clicking on the previous item, the hidden item will become visible. If the OverflowMode is Collapsed, only the first and last items will be visible, and the remaining items will be hidden with collapsed icon. When the collapsed icon is clicked, all items become visible and scroll will be enabled if the space is not enough to show all items. If the OverflowMode is Menu, it shows the number of breadcrumb items that can be accommodated within the container space, and creates a sub menu with the remaining items. If the OverflowMode is Wrap, it wraps the items on multiple lines when the Breadcrumbs width exceeds the container space. If the OverflowMode is Scroll, it shows an HTML scroll bar when the Breadcrumbs width exceeds the container space. If the OverflowMode is None, it shows all the items on a single line.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfContextMenu`1
member.summary: ContextMenu is a graphical user interface that appears on the user right click/touch hold operation.
ContextMenu is a graphical user interface that appears on the user right click/touch hold operation.
member.example:
In the below code example, showcases a basic context menu.
<SfContextMenu Target="#contextmenutarget" TValue="MenuItem"> <MenuItems> <MenuItem Text="Cut" IconCss="e-cm-icons e-cut"></MenuItem> <MenuItem Text="Copy" IconCss="e-cm-icons e-copy"></MenuItem> <MenuItem Text="Paste" IconCss="e-cm-icons e-paste"></MenuItem> </MenuItems> </SfContextMenu>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfDropDownTree`2.AllowFiltering
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the filtering option is enabled in the component.
member.value: Set to true to enable the filtering functionality; otherwise, set to 'false'.
member.remarks: Filter action is performed when the user types in the search box, and the matched items are collected through the 'Filtering' event. If searching character does not match, `NoRecordsTemplate` property value will be shown.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfDropDownTree`2.AllowMultiSelection
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether multi-selection of nodes is enabled in the component.
member.value: Set to true if multi-selection is enabled; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: When multi-selection is enabled, users can select multiple nodes in the component by holding down the CTRL key and clicking on the nodes they want to select. Consecutive nodes can be selected by holding down the SHIFT key and clicking on the initial and final nodes of the range to be selected. The property can also be used to enable checkbox support for node selection.

The following properties will be stored in browser local storage to persist the state of the component when the page reloads:
Value The value of nodes that are selected in the Dropdown Tree component.
Text The text of nodes that are selected in the Dropdown Tree component.

member.remarks: This property value is updated only when the is enabled.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfDropDownTree`2.FilterType
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates the filter type,the component needs to be considered on search action.
member.value: One of the enumeration. The default value is
member.remarks: If the FilterType is StartsWith, the filtering will be performed using starts with operator. If the FilterType is EndsWith, the filtering will be performed using ends with operator. If the FilterType is Contains, the filtering will be performed using contains operator.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfDropDownTree`2.FloatLabelType
member.summary:
Gets or sets the floating label behavior of the input that the placeholder text floats above the input based on the following values.
Possible values are:
Never The label will never float in the input when the placeholder is available.
Always The floating label will always float above the input.
Auto The floating label will float above the input after focusing or entering a value in the input.
member.value: The default value is Never.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfDropDownTree`2.IgnoreCase
member.summary: Gets or sets whether case-sensitivity is enabled or disabled when searching for suggestions.
member.value: Set to false, consider the `case-sensitive` on performing the search to find suggestions. The default value is true.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfDropDownTree`2.Mode
member.summary:
Gets or sets the possible values for visualizing selected items in the component when or is enabled. Possible values are:
Box Selected items will be visualized in chip format.
Delimiter Selected items will be visualized in the text content.
Default When focused, the component will act in the box mode. When blurred, the component will act in the delimiter mode.
member.value: Specifies the mode that determines the visibility and interactivity of the component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfDropDownTree`2.Placeholder
member.summary: Gets or sets the placeholder value that describes the expected value of the Dropdown Tree component.
member.value: Accepts a string. The default value is Null.

member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the popup list. By default, it renders based on its list item.
member.value: Accepts the string value. The default value is 300px.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfDropDownTree`2.PopupWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the popup list and percentage values is calculated based on input width.
member.value: Accepts the string value. The default value is 100%.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfDropDownTree`2.HtmlAttributes
member.summary: Gets or sets a a value that indicates the collection of additional attributes that will be applied to the container element.
member.value: The value as dictionary collection.The default value is null
member.remarks: Additional attributes can be added by specifying as inline attributes or by specifying @attributes directive.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfDropDownTree`2.ShowCheckBox
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to show checkboxes in each node of the component popup.
member.value: Set to true to show checkboxes on each tree view node in the popup; otherwise, 'false'. The default value is false.
member.remarks: The `ShowCheckBox` property is used to show or hide the checkboxes in tree nodes of popup list. The checkboxes have tri-state behavior, such as checked, unchecked, and indeterminate. The check/uncheck action can be performed either through checkbox click or pressing the space key. The checkboxes are displayed next to the expand/collapse icon of the nodes.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfDropDownTree`2.ShowClearButton
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value that indicates whether the clear button is displayed in the input.
member.value: Set to true, if the clear button should be shown. Otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Enabling this option adds a clear button to the input, allowing users to clear multiple selected values at once.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfDropDownTree`2.ShowSelectAll
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether to show or hide the selectAll option on the component.
member.value: Set to true, if the select all option should be shown. Otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Enabling this option allows users to select all items in the popup through a single checkbox action.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfDropDownTree`2.SortOrder
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how the items are sorted in ascending or descending order, or not sorted at all.
member.value:
Available sort order types include:
None The items are not sorted.
Ascending The items are sorted in ascending order.
Descending The items are sorted in descending order.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfDropDownTree`2.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the display text of the selected item, which corresponds to the data text field in the component.
member.value: The default value is Null.
member.remarks: This property stores the selected text value(s) that are displayed in the input of the Dropdown Tree.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfDropDownTree`2.Value
member.summary: Gets the value of the selected item in the Dropdown Tree component. This will be used with a two-way binding.
member.value: The value of the selected item in the Dropdown Tree component. The default is null.
member.remarks: Use the property to specify or determine the value displayed in the component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfDropDownTree`2.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the component.
member.value: The preferred width of the drop down tree can be in pixels or percentage value. The default value is 100%.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfDropDownTree`2.ZIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the z-index value of the component popup element.
member.value: The ZIndex value for the popup element.The default value is 1000.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfDropDownTree`2.AutoUpdateCheckState
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether the checked state of parent nodes in the component is automatically updated based on the checked state of their child nodes.
member.value: true if automatic update of parent node checked states is enabled; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: When the property is set to `true`, the checked state of parent nodes in the component will be automatically updated based on the checked state of their child nodes. This is useful for maintaining the consistency of the checkbox hierarchy and ensuring that parent nodes are checked only if all their child nodes are also checked. This property only works when the property is set to `true`.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfDropDownTree`2.LoadOnDemand
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether child nodes will be rendered while expanding and collapsing a parent node inside the popup, instead of loading all tree nodes initially in the component.
member.value: Set to true to load child nodes dynamically on expanding a parent node; otherwise, set to false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: By default, is disabled, so child nodes are rendered during initial rendering. Enabling this property as true can improve the performance of the component on initial load, as it loads only parent nodes initially.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfDropDownTree`2.ExpandOn
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that indicates the action on which the node expands or collapses in the popup of the component.
member.value: The default value is ExpandAction.DoubleClick.
member.remarks: The available actions are: - ExpandAction.Click: The expand/collapse operation happens when you single-click on the node in desktop. - ExpandAction.DblClick: The expand/collapse operation happens when you double-click on the node in desktop. - ExpandAction.None: The expand/collapse operation will not happen. In mobile devices, the node expand/collapse action happens on single tap always.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfDropDownTree`2.TextWrap
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to wrap the selected items into multiple lines when the selected item's text content exceeds the input width limit.
member.value: true, if the selected items into multiple lines. Otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfDropDownTree`2.SelectedItemTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the template that will be added to the input instead of the selected item text in the component when the or support is enabled.
member.value: The template content. The default value is null.
member.remarks: This property is used to customize the display text of the selected items in the . When setting this property, the mode must be set to `custom` in the Dropdown Tree.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfDropDownTree`2.ValueChanged
member.summary: Gets or sets a callback that triggers when the value changed in the component.
member.value: An event callback function.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfDropDownTree`2.OnActionFailure
member.summary: Gets or sets an event callback that is raised while any Dropdown Tree action failed to fetch the desired results.

member.summary: Gets or sets the text to append as a prefix with numeric values in the Pager.
member.value: A prefix for numeric item. The default value is string.Empty.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfPager.ShowPagerMessage
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to enable or disable the Pager message, displayed on the right side of the Pager icons.
member.value: true If `ShowPagerMessage` is set to true, the pager information such as the current page, total pages, and total records count is displayed.
member.remarks: By default the ShowPagerMessage is set to true.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfPager.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to enable the persistence in the Pager, It will allow access to store the current state of the Pager.
member.value: true If `EnablePersistence` is set to true, It will store the pager state such as current page, page size, current focus, and pager dropdown in the window.localStorage when the component is disposed.
member.remarks: By default the EnablePersistence is set to false.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfPager.NumericItemsCount
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates the number of page numeric buttons shown on the pager user interface.
member.value: The number of page numeric buttons shown on the pager UI.
member.remarks: If NumericItemsCount is 5 and the total number of pages is 20, then the pager will display numeric buttons for pages 1 to 5. Users can navigate beyond this range using the next page and end-page buttons. Also, if the given numeric items count is greater than the total number of pages, then all the pages are shown in the Pager component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfPager.PageSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of items shown on a single page.
member.value: The number of items shown on a single page, by default the value is 12.
member.remarks: When the given page size is greater than the total items present in the Pager, then all the items are dispalyed in the current page.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfPager.PageSizes
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of items in the Pager dropdown. Update what number of items can be rendered on a page by changing the dropdown value.
member.value: The list of items to be shown in the Pager dropdown, by default the value is set to null.
member.remarks: When one of the given page sizes is greater than the total items present in the Pager, when the particular dropdown is chosen all the items are dispalyed in the current page.

example.code:
<SfPager PageSizes=@pagesizes PageSize=10 TotalItemsCount=100 >
            </SfPager>
            @code{
               public List<int> pagesizes = new List<int> { 5, 10, 12, 20 };
            }

member.value: true If `ShowAllInPageSizes` is set to true, then added All value as one of the option in .
member.remarks: should be updated with list items for this property, otherwise it's not needed. The default value is false.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfPager.GoToPageAsync(System.Int32)
member.summary: Navigates to the given page number in the Pager, it can also fetch the given page by traversing between the next and previous pagers if present in the Pager component.
member.param: Enter the page number to be shown in the Pager.
member.remarks: When the given page number is greater than the total pages, then no actions will be performed in the Pager.

example.code:
<button @onclick="HandleButtonClick">GoToPage</button>
            <SfPager @ref="Pager" PageSize=5 NumericItemsCount=4 TotalItemsCount=100>
             ........
            </SfPager>
            @code{
               SfPager Pager;
               private async Task HandleButtonClick()
               {
                 await Pager.GoToPageAsync(10); // pass the page number here.    
               }
            }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfPager.GoToLastPageAsync
member.summary: Navigates to the last page in the Pager by traversing the next pagers, if present in the Pager component.
member.remarks: If the current selected page is the last page of the Pager, then no actions will be performed in the Pager component.

example.code:
<button @onclick="HandleButtonClick">GoToLastPage</button>
            <SfPager @ref="Pager" PageSize=5 NumericItemsCount=4 TotalItemsCount=100>
             ........
            </SfPager>
            @code{
               SfPager Pager;
               private async Task HandleButtonClick()
               {
                 await Pager.GoToLastPageAsync();
               }
            }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfPager.GoToFirstPageAsync
member.summary: Navigates to the first page in the Pager, by traversing the previous pagers if present in the Pager component.
member.remarks: If the current selected page is the first page of the Pager, then no actions will be performed in the Pager component.

example.code:
<button @onclick="HandleButtonClick">GoToFirstPage</button>
            <SfPager @ref="Pager" PageSize=5 NumericItemsCount=4 TotalItemsCount=100>
             ........
            </SfPager>
            @code{
               SfPager Pager;
               private async Task HandleButtonClick()
               {
                 await Pager.GoToFirstPageAsync();
               }
            }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfPager.GoToNextPageAsync
member.summary: Navigate to the next page in the Pager. Consider the currently selected page is the last numeric item of the Pager, then it's loaded the next set of numeric items if it exists.
member.remarks: If the currently selected page is the last page of the Pager and if the next page icon and the last page icon is disabled, then no actions will be performed.

example.code:
<button @onclick="HandleButtonClick">GoToNextPage</button>
            <SfPager @ref="Pager" PageSize=5 NumericItemsCount=4 TotalItemsCount=100>
             ........
            </SfPager>
            @code{
               SfPager Pager;
               private async Task HandleButtonClick()
               {
                 await Pager.GoToNextPageAsync();
               }
            }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfPager.GoToPreviousPageAsync
member.summary: Navigate to the previous page in the Pager. Consider the currently selected page is the first numeric item of the Pager, then it's loaded the previous set of numeric items if it exists.
member.remarks: If the currently selected page is the first page of the Pager and if the previous icon and the previous page icon is disabled, then no actions will be performed.

example.code:
<button @onclick="HandleButtonClick">GoToPreviousPage</button>
            <SfPager @ref="Pager" PageSize=5 NumericItemsCount=4 TotalItemsCount=100>
             ........
            </SfPager>
            @code{
               SfPager Pager;
               private async Task HandleButtonClick()
               {
                 await Pager.GoToPreviousPageAsync();
               }
            }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfPager.UpdatePageSizeAsync(System.Int32)
member.summary: Used to update the page size of the Pager to change the number of items that can be rendered on a Page.
member.param: The number of items to be shown on a page.
member.remarks: By changing the page size, the Pager component dynamically updates the total number of pages, numeric item count, next, and previous pagers count according to the given page size and updates the UI.

example.code:
<button @onclick="HandleButtonClick">UpdatePageSize</button>
            <SfPager @ref="Pager" PageSize=5 NumericItemsCount=4 TotalItemsCount=100>
             ........
            </SfPager>
            @code{
               SfPager Pager;
               private async Task HandleButtonClick()
               {
                 await Pager.UpdatePageSizeAsync(10); // pass the page size here.    
               }
            }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfPager.UpdateNumericItemsCountAsync(System.Int32)
member.summary: Used to update the number of numeric elements shown in the Pager component, and the next pager icon is used to get the next set of entered numeric pages count, likewise the previous pager icon is used to traverse backward between the pages.
member.param: The given number of numeric elements are shown in the Pager.
member.remarks: If the given numeric item count is greater than the total pages present in the Pager, then all the numeric items are shown in the Pager component.

example.code:
<button @onclick="HandleButtonClick">UpdateNumericItemsCount</button>
            <SfPager @ref="Pager" PageSize=5 NumericItemsCount=4 TotalItemsCount=100>
             ........
            </SfPager>
            @code{
               SfPager Pager;
               private async Task HandleButtonClick()
               {
                 await Pager.UpdateNumericItemsCountAsync(6); // pass the numeric items count here.    
               }
            }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfPager.RefreshAsync
member.summary: Applies all the property changes and re-renders the component again.

example.code:
<button @onclick="HandleButtonClick">Refresh</button>
            <SfPager @ref="Pager" PageSize=5 NumericItemsCount=4 TotalItemsCount=100>
             ........
            </SfPager>
            @code{
               SfPager Pager;
               private async Task HandleButtonClick()
               {
                 await Pager.UpdatePageSizeAsync(10);
                 await Pager.RefreshAsync();
               }
            }

<SfStepper> <StepperSteps> <StepperStep></StepperStep> <StepperStep></StepperStep> <StepperStep></StepperStep> <StepperStep></StepperStep> <StepperStep></StepperStep> </StepperSteps> </SfStepper>

member.remarks: Changing this property on demand will update the active step, but it will respect the flow if enabled.

example.code: ActiveStep = -1 1 - Not Started 2 - Not Started 3 - Not Started 4 - Not Started
ActiveStep = 0 1 - In Progress 2 - Not Started 3 - Not Started 4 - Not Started
ActiveStep = 1 1 - Completed 2 - In Progress 3 - Not Started 4 - Not Started
ActiveStep = 3 1 - Completed 2 - Completed 3 - Completed 4 - In Progress

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfToolbar.OverflowMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates how to display toolbar items when the toolbar content exceeds the viewing area.
member.value: One of the enumeration. The default value is
member.remarks: If the OverflowMode is Scrollable, all the elements are displayed in a single line with enabled horizontal scrolling. If the OverflowMode is Popup, prioritized elements are displayed on the toolbar and the rest of elements are moved to the popup. If the popup content overflows the height of the page, the rest of the elements will be hidden. If the OverflowMode is MultiRow, overflow toolbar items are displayed as in-line of toolbar. If the OverflowMode is Extended, hides the overflow items in next row. The extended content were shown when click on the expand icon.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfToolbar.ScrollStep
member.summary: Gets or sets the scrolling distance of toolbar scroller.
member.value: When the left/right navigation icon is clicked, then the toolbar scrolled based on the specified value otherwise the default value `0` is set.
member.remarks: This property is applicable only when is set.

member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the toolbar element in pixels/number/percentage.
member.value: If we set the width value, then the toolbar will render based on specified width otherwise the default width value `auto` is set.
member.remarks: If we set number values, then it is considered as pixels.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.OverflowMode
member.summary: Specifies the display mode for the Toolbar component when the content exceeds the available space.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.OverflowMode.Scrollable
member.summary: Displays all the elements in a single line with horizontal scrolling enabled.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.OverflowMode.Popup
member.summary: Displays prioritized elements on the Toolbar and moves the rest of the elements to a popup.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.OverflowMode.MultiRow
member.summary: Displays the overflow toolbar items as an in-line of the toolbar.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.OverflowMode.Extended
member.summary: Hides the overflowing toolbar items in the next row and shows them when clicking the expand icons. If the popup content overflows the height of the page, the rest of the elements will be hidden.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.DisplayMode
member.summary: Specifies where the text is displayed in the popup mode of the Toolbar.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.DisplayMode.Both
member.summary: Displays the text on the Toolbar and popup.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.DisplayMode.Overflow
member.summary: Displays the text only when the content overflows to the popup.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.DisplayMode.Toolbar
member.summary: Displays the text only on the Toolbar.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemAlign
member.summary: Specifies the alignment of the Toolbar items.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemAlign.Left
member.summary: Aligns the commands to the left side of the Toolbar.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemAlign.Center
member.summary: Aligns the commands at the center of the Toolbar.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemAlign.Right
member.summary: Aligns the commands to the right side of the Toolbar.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemType
member.summary: Specifies the element types supported by the Toolbar component.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemType.Button
member.summary: Creates a Button control with its given properties like text, prefixIcon, etc.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemType.Separator
member.summary: Adds a horizontal line that separates the Toolbar commands.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemType.Spacer
member.summary: Adds a space between the Toolbar items. This can be achieved by using the flex-grow property as 1.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemType.Input
member.summary: Creates an input element that is applicable to template rendering with Syncfusion controls like DropDownList, AutoComplete, etc.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.OverflowOption
member.summary: Specifies the display area of the Toolbar item when the Toolbar content overflows the available space. This option is applicable in the `Popup` mode.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.OverflowOption.None
member.summary: No priority for display, and as per the normal order, moves to the popup when the content exceeds.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.OverflowOption.Show
member.summary: Always shows the item as the primary priority on the Toolbar.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.OverflowOption.Hide
member.summary: Always shows the item as the secondary priority on the popup.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem
member.summary: A class that represents toolbar component item of component.
member.remarks: You can render icon only, text only, icon and text toolbar item by specifying value to corresponding property.
member.example:
In the below code example, a basic toolbar item has been added using tag directive.
<SfToolbar> <ToolbarItems> <ToolbarItem Text="Cut" PrefixIcon="e-icons e-cut"></ToolbarItem> <ToolbarItem Text="Copy" PrefixIcon="e-icons e-copy"></ToolbarItem> <ToolbarItem Text="Paste" PrefixIcon="e-icons e-paste"></ToolbarItem> </ToolbarItems> </SfToolbar>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.ChildContent
member.summary: Gets or sets the child content for the toolbar item.
member.value: The value used to build the content.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.OnClick
member.summary: Event triggers when click the toolbar item.
member.remarks: You can get the clicked toolbar item details.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Align
member.summary: Gets or sets the location for aligning toolbar items on the toolbar.
member.value: One of the enumeration. The default value is
member.remarks: If the ItemAlign is Left, the toolbar item aligned from left side of toolbar. If the ItemAlign is Center, the toolbar item aligned from center of toolbar. If the ItemAlign is Right, the toolbar item aligned from right side of toolbar. Each item will be aligned according to the Align property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.CssClass
member.summary: Gets or sets the classes for toolbar item to customize the toolbar item.
member.value: If we set the css class, then the custom class is applied for toolbar item. The default value is string.Empty.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Disabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the toolbar item is disabled or not.
member.value: true, to disable the toolbar item. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.HtmlAttributes
member.summary: Gets or sets a collection of additional attributes that will be applied to the toolbar item element.
member.value: It allows the toolbar item to render non-declared attributes. The default value is `null`.
member.remarks: Additional attributes can be added by specifying as inline attributes or by specifying @attributes directive.
member.example:
In the below code example, title attribute were added for toolbar item.
<SfToolbar> <ToolbarItems> <ToolbarItem Text="Cut" id="item1"></ToolbarItem> </ToolbarItems> </SfToolbar>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Id
member.summary: Gets or sets the unique ID for toolbar button or input element.
member.value: Accepts a string value. The default value is String.Empty.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Overflow
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to display the toolbar item on toolbar or not, when the content is too large to fit available space.
member.value: One of the enumeration. The default value is
member.remarks: If the OverflowOption is Show, always shows the toolbar item as the primary priority on the Toolbar. If the OverflowOption is Hide, always shows the toolbar item as the secondary priority on the popup. If the OverflowOption is None, no priority were set for toolbar item, as per normal order moves to popup when content exceeds. This property is applicable only when is Popup of Extended.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.PrefixIcon
member.summary: Gets or sets the classes to display an icon for toolbar button item.
member.value: Accepts a string value. The default value is String.Empty.
member.remarks: The icon will be positioned before the text content if is available, otherwise the icon alone will be rendered.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.ShowAlwaysInPopup
member.summary: Gets or sets the toolbar items whether to display always in popup or not.
member.value: true, to render the toolbar item in popup. The default value is false.
member.remarks: It allows to maintain toolbar item on popup always but it does not work for toolbar priority items. This property is applicable only when is Popup of Extended.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.TabIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the tab order of the Toolbar items. When positive values assigned, it allows to switch focus to the next/previous toolbar items with Tab/ShiftTab keys.
member.value: Tab index of toolbar item. The default value is `-1`.
member.remarks: By default, user can able to switch between items only via arrow keys. If the value is set to 0 for all tool bar items, then tab switches based on element order.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.ShowTextOn
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to display the button text on toolbar or popup.
member.value: One of the enumeration. The default value is
member.remarks: If the DisplayMode is Toolbar, text will be displayed on Toolbar only. If the DisplayMode is Overflow, text will be displayed only when content overflows to popup. If the DisplayMode is Both, text will be displayed on both popup and Toolbar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.SuffixIcon
member.summary: Gets or sets the classes to display an icon for toolbar button item.
member.value: Accepts a string value. The default value is String.Empty.
member.remarks: The icon will be positioned after the text content if is available, otherwise the icon alone will be rendered.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Template
member.summary: Gets or sets the HTML element content for the toolbar item.
member.value: The value used to build the content.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the text content for toolbar button item.
member.value: Accepts a string value. The default value is String.Empty.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.TooltipText
member.summary: Gets or sets the tooltip text content to be displayed on hovering the toolbar button item.
member.value: Accepts a string value. The default value is String.Empty.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Type
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates the type of toolbar item to be rendered in toolbar.
member.value: One of the enumeration. The default value is
member.remarks: If the ItemType is Button, creates the Button control with its given properties like text, prefixIcon, etc. If the ItemType is Separator, adds a horizontal line that separates the toolbar item. If the ItemType is Spacer, adds a space that separates the toolbar item. If the ItemType is Input, creates an input element that is applicable to template rendering with Syncfusion controls like DropDownList, AutoComplete, etc.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Visible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the toolbar item is hidden or not.
member.value: false, to hide the toolbar item. The default value is true.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the toolbar button item in pixels/number/percentage.
member.value: If we set the width value, then the toolbar button item will render based on specified width otherwise the default width value auto is set.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.AllowDragAndDrop
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the TreeView allows drag and drop of nodes for reordering.
member.value: true if drag and drop is allowed; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: In desktop devices, drag and drop a node using the mouse by clicking on the node and dragging it to the target node, and then releasing the mouse. In touch devices, drag and drop nodes using touch start, touch move, and touch end events.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.AllowEditing
member.summary: Gets or sets whether allow to edit a node's text by pressing F2 key or double-click on a node.
member.value: true, if editing is allowed; otherwise 'false'. The default value is false.
member.remarks: When `AllowEditing` property is set to true, the TreeView allows to edit a node by double clicking on the node or by navigating to the node and pressing F2 key. When the property is set to false, the TreeView allows to read the node text only.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.AllowMultiSelection
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether multi-selection of nodes is enabled in the control.
member.value: true if multi-selection is enabled; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: When multi-selection is enabled, users can select multiple nodes in the control by holding down the CTRL key and clicking on the nodes they want to select. Consecutive nodes can be selected by holding down the SHIFT key and clicking on the initial and final nodes of the range to be selected. The property can also be used to enable checkbox support for node selection.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.AllowTextWrap
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the text of nodes in the control is allowed to wrap to the next line when it exceeds the width of the node.
member.value: true if text wrapping is enabled; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: When the `AllowTextWrap` property is set to `true`, the text of nodes in the control will wrap to the next line if its length exceeds the width of the node. This can be useful for displaying long or multi-line text in the tree view without truncating or clipping it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.AutoCheck
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether the checked state of parent nodes in the control is automatically updated based on the checked state of their child nodes.
member.value: true if the automatic update of parent node checked states is enabled; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: When the `AutoCheck` property is set to `true`, the checked state of parent nodes in the control will be automatically updated based on the checked state of their child nodes. This can be useful for maintaining the consistency of the tree view's checkbox hierarchy and ensuring that parent nodes are only checked if all of their child nodes are also checked. This property only works when the `ShowCheckBox` property is set to `true`.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.CheckedNodes
member.summary: Gets or sets the IDs of the nodes that are checked in the control.
member.value: A collection of strings containing the IDs of the nodes that are checked in the tree view.
member.remarks: The `CheckedNodes` property supports two-way binding in the control. By passing a collection of node IDs to the property, the checked state of the specified nodes can be set. The property can also be used to retrieve the IDs of the nodes that are currently checked in the tree view.

example.code:
<SfTreeView TValue="MusicAlbum" ShowCheckBox="true" @bind-CheckedNodes="@CheckedNodes">
                <TreeViewFieldsSettings TValue="MusicAlbum" Id="Id" DataSource="@Albums" Text="Name" ParentID="ParentId" HasChildren="HasChild" Expanded="Expanded" IsChecked="IsChecked"></TreeViewFieldsSettings>
            </SfTreeView>
            @code{
                string[] CheckedNodes = new string[] { "16","18" };
            }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.CheckedNodesChanged
member.summary: Raised when the checked state of the node's checkbox has changed in the control.
member.value: An event callback function.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.CssClass
member.summary: Gets or sets one or more CSS classes that can be used to customize the appearance of the control.
member.value: A string containing one or more CSS class names separated by spaces. The default value is `String.Empty`.
member.remarks: When one or more CSS classes are set on the `CssClass` property, the corresponding styles will be applied to the UI elements of the control.

example.code:
<SfTreeView TValue="MusicAlbum" CssClass="e-custom e-tree">
                 <TreeViewFieldsSettings TValue="MusicAlbum" Id="Id" DataSource="@Albums" Text="Name" ParentID="ParentId" HasChildren="HasChild" Expanded="Expanded" IsChecked="IsChecked"></TreeViewFieldsSettings>
             </SfTreeView>
            
             @code{
                 public class MusicAlbum
                 {
                     public int Id { get; set; }
                     public int? ParentId { get; set; }
                     public string Name { get; set; }
                     public bool Expanded { get; set; }
                     public bool? IsChecked { get; set; }
                     public bool HasChild { get; set; }
                 }
            
                 List<MusicAlbum> Albums = new List<MusicAlbum>();
            
                 protected override void OnInitialized()
                 {
                     base.OnInitialized();
                     Albums.Add(new MusicAlbum
                     {
                         Id = 14,
                         HasChild = true,
                         Name = "MP3 Albums",
                         Expanded = true
                     });
                     Albums.Add(new MusicAlbum
                     {
                         Id = 15,
                         ParentId = 14,
                         Name = "Rock"
                     });
                     Albums.Add(new MusicAlbum
                     {
                         Id = 16,
                         Name = "Gospel",
                         ParentId = 14,
                     });
                     Albums.Add(new MusicAlbum
                     {
                         Id = 17,
                         ParentId = 14,
                         Name = "Latin Music"
                     });
                     Albums.Add(new MusicAlbum
                     {
                         Id = 18,
                         ParentId = 14,
                         Name = "Jazz"
                     });
                 }
             }
            
             <style>
                 .e-custom .e-tree {
                     padding: 10px 0;
                     font-weight: 800;
                 }
                 .custom.e-treeview .e-fullrow {
                     height: 200px;
                 }
             </style>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.Disabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the component.
member.value: true, if the TreeView component is disabled. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.DropArea
member.summary: Gets or sets the target in which the draggable node can be moved and dropped.
member.value: Accepts the string value.
member.remarks: By default, the draggable element can be moved within the TreeView. To specify a different drop target, set the `DropArea` property to the ID or CSS class of the element that should act as the drop target.

example.code:
<div class="treeParent">
                 <SfTreeView TValue="MusicAlbum" DropArea=".treeParent">
                     <TreeViewFieldsSettings TValue="MusicAlbum" Id="Id" DataSource="@Albums" Text="Name" ParentID="ParentId" HasChildren="HasChild" Expanded="Expanded" IsChecked="IsChecked"></TreeViewFieldsSettings>
                 </SfTreeView>
             <div>
               @code{
                public class MusicAlbum
                {
                    public int Id { get; set; }
                    public int? ParentId { get; set; }
                    public string Name { get; set; }
                    public bool Expanded { get; set; }
                    public bool? IsChecked { get; set; }
                    public bool HasChild { get; set; }
                }
                List<MusicAlbum> Albums = new List<MusicAlbum>();
               protected override void OnInitialized()
               {
                    base.OnInitialized();
                    Albums.Add(new MusicAlbum
                 {
                   Id = 14,
                    HasChild = true,
                    Name = "MP3 Albums",
                    Expanded = true
                });
                 Albums.Add(new MusicAlbum
                {
                    Id = 15,
                    ParentId = 14,
                    Name = "Rock"
                });
                }
               }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to persist the state of the component between page reloads.
member.value: true, if the component's state persistence is enabled. The default value is false.
member.remarks:
The following properties will be stored in browser local storage to persist the state of the component when the page reloads:
SelectedNodes The nodes that are selected in the TreeView component.
CheckedNodes The nodes that are checked in the TreeView component.
ExpandedNodes The nodes that are expanded in the TreeView component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.EnableRtl
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the right to left direction is enabled for the component.
member.value: true, if the right to left direction is enabled for the component. The default value is false.
member.remarks: When set to true, the layout of the component will be rendered from right to left.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.ExpandOn
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that indicates the action on which the node expands or collapses in the component.
member.value: The default value is `ExpandAction.DblClick`.
member.remarks: The available actions are: - `ExpandAction.Click` - The expand/collapse operation happens when you single-click on the node in desktop. - `ExpandAction.DblClick` - The expand/collapse operation happens when you double-click on the node in desktop. - `ExpandAction.None` - The expand/collapse operation will not happen. In mobile devices, the node expand/collapse action happens on single tap always.

example.code:
<SfTreeView TValue="MusicAlbum" ExpandOn="ExpandAction.Click">
               <TreeViewFieldsSettings TValue="MusicAlbum" Id="Id" DataSource="@Albums" Text="Name" ParentID="ParentId" HasChildren="HasChild" Expanded="Expanded" IsChecked="IsChecked"></TreeViewFieldsSettings>
            </SfTreeView>
            @code{
               public class MusicAlbum
               {
                   public int Id { get; set; }
                   public int? ParentId { get; set; }
                   public string Name { get; set; }
                   public bool Expanded { get; set; }
                   public bool? IsChecked { get; set; }
                   public bool HasChild { get; set; }
               }
               SfTreeView<MusicAlbum> tree;
               List<MusicAlbum> Albums = new List<MusicAlbum>();
               protected override void OnInitialized()
               {
                   base.OnInitialized();
                   Albums.Add(new MusicAlbum
                   {
                       Id = 14,
                       HasChild = true,
                       Name = "MP3 Albums",
                       Expanded = true
                   });
                   Albums.Add(new MusicAlbum
                   {
                       Id = 15,
                       ParentId = 14,
                       Name = "Rock"
                   });
                   Albums.Add(new MusicAlbum
                   {
                       Id = 16,
                       Name = "Gospel",
                       ParentId = 14,
                   });
                   Albums.Add(new MusicAlbum
                   {
                       Id = 17,
                       ParentId = 14,
                       Name = "Latin Music"
                   });
                   Albums.Add(new MusicAlbum
                   {
                       Id = 18,
                       ParentId = 14,
                       Name = "Jazz"
                   });
               }
            }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.ExpandedNodes
member.summary: Gets or sets the ID of expanded nodes in the component.
member.value: Pass the node's ID as a string array collection.
member.remarks: This property is used to keep track of which nodes in the TreeView are currently expanded, allowing the user to retain their current view of the tree when the application is closed and reopened. This property supports two-way binding, so any changes made to the expanded nodes in the TreeView will be reflected in the bound string array collection.
member.example:
<SfTreeView TValue="MusicAlbum" ShowCheckBox="true" @bind-ExpandedNodes="@ExpandedNodes">
             <TreeViewFieldsSettings TValue="MusicAlbum" Id="Id" DataSource="@Albums" Text="Name" ParentID="ParentId" HasChildren="HasChild" Expanded="Expanded" IsChecked="IsChecked"></TreeViewFieldsSettings>
             </SfTreeView>
            
               @code{
                public class MusicAlbum
                {
                    public int Id { get; set; }
                    public int? ParentId { get; set; }
                    public string Name { get; set; }
                    public bool Expanded { get; set; }
                    public bool? IsChecked { get; set; }
                    public bool HasChild { get; set; }
                }
                string[] ExpandedNodes = new string[] { "16","18" };
                List<MusicAlbum> Albums = new List<MusicAlbum>();
               protected override void OnInitialized()
               {
                    base.OnInitialized();
                    Albums.Add(new MusicAlbum
                 {
                   Id = 14,
                    HasChild = true,
                    Name = "MP3 Albums"
                });
                 Albums.Add(new MusicAlbum
                {
                    Id = 15,
                    ParentId = 14,
                    Name = "Rock"
                });
                }
             }
             
             In this example, the `ExpandedNodes` property is bound to a string array containing the ID of the expanded nodes in the TreeView. The `MusicAlbum` class is used to define the data structure of each node in the tree, and the `Albums` list is populated with sample data in the `OnInitialized` method. The `ShowCheckBox` property is set to `true` to enable checkboxes for each node.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.ExpandedNodesChanged
member.summary: This event is raised whenever the expanded state of a node in the component changes. The callback will receive an array of strings containing the IDs of the nodes whose expanded state has changed. This can be used to update the application's state or perform other actions in response to changes in the expanded nodes.
member.value: An event callback function.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.TreeViewFields
member.summary: Gets or sets the data source and mapping fields to render TreeView nodes.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.FullRowNavigable
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the entire node will be navigable, instead of just the text element.
member.value: Set to 'true' to make the entire TreeView node navigable; otherwise 'false'. The default value is 'false'.
member.remarks: When this property is set to 'true', navigation occurs when the user clicks on any part of the TreeView node. Otherwise, navigation occurs only when the user clicks on the text of the TreeView node.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.FullRowSelect
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the entire row of the node gets selected by clicking a node.
member.value: Set to 'true' to select the entire node when clicked; otherwise, only the node's text section will be selected. The default value is 'true'.
member.remarks: If this property is set to 'true', the entire tree node will be selectable when clicked. Otherwise, only the text section of the node will be selected.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.LoadOnDemand
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether child nodes will be rendered while expanding and collapsing a parent node, instead of loading all tree nodes initially in the component.
member.value: Set to 'true' to load child nodes dynamically on expanding a parent node; otherwise, set to 'false'. The default value is 'true'.
member.remarks: By default, 'LoadOnDemand' is enabled, so child nodes are rendered dynamically when a parent node is expanded. This property can improve the performance of the component on initial load, by only loading parent nodes initially. If this property is set to 'false', all parent and child nodes are rendered on initial load.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.SelectedNodes
member.summary: Gets or sets the ID of selected nodes in the component.
member.value: Pass the node's ID as a string array collection.
member.remarks: The property SelectedNodes supports two-way binding, so any changes made to the selected nodes in the TreeView will be reflected in the bound string array collection. This property is used to keep track of which nodes in the TreeView are currently selected.

example.code:
<SfTreeView TValue="MusicAlbum" @bind-SelectedNodes="@SelectedNodes">
             <TreeViewFieldsSettings TValue="MusicAlbum" Id="Id" DataSource="@Albums" Text="Name" ParentID="ParentId" HasChildren="HasChild" Expanded="Expanded" IsChecked="IsChecked"></TreeViewFieldsSettings>
            </SfTreeView>
             
               @code{
                public class MusicAlbum
                {
                    public int Id { get; set; }
                    public int? ParentId { get; set; }
                    public string Name { get; set; }
                    public bool Expanded { get; set; }
                    public bool? IsChecked { get; set; }
                    public bool HasChild { get; set; }
                }
                string[] SelectedNodes = new string[] { "16","18" };
                List<MusicAlbum> Albums = new List<MusicAlbum>();
               protected override void OnInitialized()
               {
                    base.OnInitialized();
                    Albums.Add(new MusicAlbum
                 {
                   Id = 14,
                    HasChild = true,
                    Name = "MP3 Albums"
                });
                 Albums.Add(new MusicAlbum
                {
                    Id = 15,
                    ParentId = 14,
                    Name = "Rock"

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.SelectedNodesChanged
member.summary: This event is raised whenever the selected state of a node changes in the component. The callback will receive an array of strings containing the IDs of the nodes whose selected state has changed. This can be used to update the application's state or perform other actions in response to changes in the selected nodes.
member.value: An event callback function.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.ShowCheckBox
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to show checkboxes in each node of the component.
member.value: 'true' to show checkboxes on each tree view node; otherwise, 'false'. The default value is false.
member.remarks: The `ShowCheckBox` property is used to show or hide the checkboxes in tree nodes. The checkboxes have tri-state behavior, such as checked, unchecked, and indeterminate. The check/uncheck action can be performed either through checkbox click or pressing the space key. The checkboxes are displayed next to the expand/collapse icon of the nodes.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.SortOrder
member.summary: Gets or sets the sort order for the nodes in the component.
member.value: A value of the enumeration.
member.remarks: The available options for the sort order are: - : The nodes are not sorted. - : The nodes are sorted in ascending order. - : The nodes are sorted in descending order.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.SortComparer
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom sort comparer object to implement own sorting logic.
member.value: Name of sort comparer object to be executed. The default value is null.
member.remarks: Custom sort comparer class should be implemented in the interface [IComparer](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.collections.generic.icomparer-1?view=net-8.0). Custom sort comparer can be used to modify the default sorting logic.

member.returns: A System.Threading.Tasks.Task that represents any asynchronous action

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.GetTreeData(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the updated data source of TreeView after performing some operation like drag and drop, node editing, node selecting/unselecting, node expanding/collapsing, node checking/unchecking, adding and removing node. When the ID of TreeView node is passed as arguments for this method then it will return the updated data source of the corresponding node otherwise it will return the entire updated data source of TreeView. The updated data source also contains the custom attributes if specified in data source.
member.param: Specifies ID of TreeView node.

member.summary: Gets or sets an event callback that is raised while any TreeView action failed to fetch the desired results.

member.summary: Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when data source is populated in the TreeView.
member.value: An event callback function.
member.remarks: The data can be modified or updated at this time when the component is updated with data source.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.TreeViewEvents`1.DataSourceChanged
member.summary: Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when data source is changed in the TreeView. The data source will be changed after performing some operation like drag and drop, node editing, adding and removing node.
member.value: An event callback function.
member.remarks: The data source change can be detected and the updated data can be fetched or stored in required cases.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.TreeViewEvents`1.Destroyed
member.summary: Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when the TreeView control is destroyed successfully.
member.value: An event callback function.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.TreeViewEvents`1.OnNodeRender
member.summary: Gets or sets an event callback that is raised before the TreeView node is appended to the TreeView element.
member.value: An event callback function.
member.remarks: A specific node can be customized at the time of rendering using this event.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.TreeViewEvents`1.OnKeyPress
member.summary: Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when key press is successful.
member.value: An event callback function.
member.remarks: Helps to customize the operations at key press.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.TreeViewEvents`1.NodeChecked
member.summary: Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when the TreeView node is checked/unchecked successfully.
member.value: An event callback function.
