member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.TreeViewFieldOptions`1
member.summary: A class used for configuring the TreeView fields setting properties.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.TreeViewFieldOptions`1.Child
member.summary: Gets or sets the string value that represents the name of the child data source holding a list of objects.

example.code:
<SfTreeView TValue="MailItem" >
                <TreeViewFieldsSettings TValue="MailItem" Child="SubFolders" DataSource="@MyFolder" Text="FolderName"></TreeViewFieldsSettings>
            </SfTreeView>
            @code{ 
                public class MailItem
                {
                   public string FolderName { get; set; }
                   public List<MailItem> SubFolders { get; set; }
                }
                List<MailItem> MyFolder = new List<MailItem>();
                List<MailItem> Folder1 = new List<MailItem>();
                MyFolder.Add(new MailItem
                {
                    SubFolders = Folder1
                });

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.TreeViewFieldOptions`1.DataSource
member.summary: Gets or sets the data source for rendering the TreeView component. The data source value can be of any type that implements IEnumerable.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.TreeViewFieldOptions`1.Expanded
member.summary: Gets or sets the mapping field for the expand state of the TreeView node.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.TreeViewFieldOptions`1.HasChildren
member.summary: Gets or sets the mapping field for determining whether a node has child nodes or not.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.TreeViewFieldOptions`1.HtmlAttributes
member.summary: Gets or sets the mapping field for adding custom HTML attributes to the TreeView node.

example.code:
<SfTreeView TValue="MailItem" >
                <TreeViewFieldsSettings TValue="MailItem" Id="Id" HtmlAttributes="HtmlAttributes"></TreeViewFieldsSettings>
            </SfTreeView>
            @code{ 
                Dictionary<string, object> HtmlAttributes = new Dictionary<string, object>() 
               { 
                   { "class", "treeview" } 
               };

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.TreeViewFieldOptions`1.DataManager
member.summary: The DataManager class provides functionality for performing data operations in applications. It serves as an abstraction layer for working with remote data sources.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.TreeViewFieldOptions`1.IconCss
member.summary: Gets or sets the mapping field for the icon class of each TreeView node, which will be added before the node's text.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.TreeViewFieldOptions`1.Id
member.summary: Gets or sets the Id field mapped in the dataSource.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.TreeViewFieldOptions`1.ImageUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the mapping field for the image URL of each TreeView node, where the image will be added before the node's text.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.TreeViewFieldOptions`1.IsChecked
member.summary: Gets or sets the field for the checked state of the TreeView node.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.TreeViewFieldOptions`1.NavigateUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the mapping field for navigateUrl to add it as the hyperlink of the TreeView node.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.TreeViewFieldOptions`1.ParentID
member.summary: Gets or sets the parent ID field mapped in the dataSource.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.TreeViewFieldOptions`1.Query
member.summary: Gets or sets the query to select particular data from the dataSource.

example.code:
<SfTreeView TValue="TreeData">
                <TreeViewFieldsSettings TValue="TreeData" Query="@Query" Id="EmployeeID" Text="FirstName" >
                    <SfDataManager Url="http://services.odata.org/V4/Northwind/Northwind.svc" Adaptor="@Syncfusion.Blazor.Adaptors.ODataV4Adaptor" CrossDomain="true">
                    </SfDataManager>
                </TreeViewFieldsSettings>
            </SfTreeView>
            @code{ 
                 public Query Query = new Query().From("Employees").Select(new List<string> { "EmployeeID", "FirstName" }).Take(5).RequiresCount();
            }
